article.title: Neural-Network Quantum States, String-Bond States, and Chiral Topological States

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following Ansatz wave functions incorporates correlations between all pairs of spins?
Which Ansatz wave function divides the lattice into overlapping clusters and uses a simple Tensor Network to describe the wave function within each cluster?
Which Ansatz wave function utilizes overlapping 1D strings to mediate correlations between spins?
Which Ansatz wave function might fail to reproduce the local structure of a state due to potentially large distances between nearby spins on the mapped line?
In the formula for Entangled Plaquette States (EPS), what does the coefficient Cₚ represent?
choices: A constant factor applied to all plaquettes.
The weight of a specific string in the overall wave function.
The wave function corresponding to the spins in plaquette p.
The entanglement entropy of plaquette p.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the formula for String-Bond States (SBS), what does the trace operator (Tr) signify?
choices: Summing over all possible hidden unit configurations.
Taking the product of all matrices within a string.
Calculating the entanglement entropy of a string.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the simplified formula for a Restricted Boltzmann Machine (RBM), what do the variables "v" and "h" represent?
choices: Visible and hidden unit configurations, respectively.
Vertical and horizontal string configurations, respectively.
Eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the Hamiltonian, respectively.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the formula for the Laughlin wave function, what is the purpose of the phase factors Xₖ?
choices: To enforce a specific total spin for the state.
To ensure the wave function is real-valued.
To incorporate long-range correlations between all spins.
To represent the wave function as a product of singlets.
